definition: to mark time (military)/to make no headway
Hara (Japanese surname)
former/original/primary/raw/level/cause/source
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
see 踏實|踏实[ta1 shi5]
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: The rest of America is stuck in neutral or reverse.
sentences.chinese: 其他美国人的状况则是原地踏步或在倒退。

sentences.english: Near the center of the park, also called Tian Tan Park, about 150 people marched in place.
sentences.chinese: 在天坛公园的中央附近，约有150个人在原地踏步。

sentences.english: You cannot move forward until you start a savings program.
sentences.chinese: 除非你开始储蓄，否则你永远将原地踏步。

sentences.english: We would be standing still or dealing with serious setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 我们只能原地踏步或忙于应对重大冲击。

definition: stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to be at a standstill/to mark time
to do less well than before/to make a concession/setback/backward step/leeway/room to maneuver/fallback
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
progress/improvement/to improve/to progress/CL:個|个[ge4]
hesitant to take action
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
great effort/to strive/to try hard
ordinary/mediocre
hidebound by convention (idiom)
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
to fall back/to go in reverse
lit. navigating a boat against the current (idiom)/fig. in a tough environment (one needs to work hard)
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
